bug.author: ajd12342
bug.summary: Unknown penalty (--unkpen) has no effect on the generated text
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
While using to generate text in the target language for a translation task, setting the value to even large numbers like 1e5, 1e6, etc. does not change the hypotheses. As a result I am unable to remove the tokens using this, as was suggested in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/issues/481>#481</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Train a model using fairseq-train Generate text using fairseq-generate with the --unkpen flag (See the code below)
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>fairseq-train $preprocess \ --seed $seed --tensorboard-logdir $expdir/tensorboard \ --lr-scheduler fixed \ --task=translation \ --num-workers $nw --batch-size $batch \ --arch=transformer \ --dropout $dropout \ --decoder-embed-path ${decoder_embed_path} --decoder-embed-dim ${dec_dim} \ --max-epoch ${max_epoch} \ --clip-norm $cn --lr $lr --update-freq 1 \ --save-dir $expdir/checkpoints \ --keep-last-epochs 5 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>fairseq-generate $preprocess \ --seed 1 \ --num-workers $nw --batch-size $batch \ --gen-subset valid \ --path $expdir/checkpoints/checkpoint_best.pt \ --results-path $resultsfile \ --unkpen $unkpen </denchmark-code>
Here $unkpen can be set to any value. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
The number of <<unk>> tokens decreases as the unknown penalty increases. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): 0.9.0 PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.2.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux (Ubuntu 18.04.2) How you installed fairseq (pip, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): Python version: 3.6.8 CUDA/cuDNN version: 10.1 GPU models and configuration: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti Any other relevant information:
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: I found out a bug in my code that probably isn't caused by the --unkpen. Thus I am closing this.
